meanings.definition: The rear surface of the human body from the shoulders to the hips.
meanings.sent1: She carried the heavy backpack on her back.
meanings.sent2: He leaned against the wall with his back.
meanings.sent3: The backpack on her back made her look like a turtle.
meanings.sent4: His back was a sturdy shield against the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sunburn on his back reminded him of the beach day.

meanings.definition: In the opposite direction from the one that one is facing or traveling.
meanings.sent1: He walked back to the starting point.
meanings.sent2: She turned back to see who called her name.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked back and forth, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to move back as they reminisced about the past.
meanings.sent5: The clock ticked back to the beginning of the race.

meanings.sent1: She always backed her friends in times of need.
meanings.sent2: The team backed each other during the tough match.
meanings.sent3: The siblings backed each other up in the argument.
meanings.sent4: His parents backed his decision to pursue his passion.
meanings.sent5: The community backed the local charity event wholeheartedly.

meanings.definition: To move in a backward direction.
meanings.sent1: The car slowly backed out of the parking spot.
meanings.sent2: She backed away from the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The dog backed up when it saw the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: He backed off when he realized he was wrong.
meanings.sent5: The hiker backed up to get a better view of the waterfall.
